h3.div: COVID-19 INFORMATION: Schools are closed for students through May 15, 2020. Follow us on Facebook for the latest updates.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-c5RTEf purZT-AhqUyc-c5RTEf pSzOP-AhqUyc-c5RTEf jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc GNzUNc

div.small: We are providing "grab-and-go" breakfast and lunch at four pick-up locations for all children within the Tupper Lake Central School District at no cost to families. Request meals for your children here.

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-c5RTEf purZT-AhqUyc-c5RTEf pSzOP-AhqUyc-c5RTEf jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc GNzUNc

div.small: All Tupper Lake Central School District students will have access to Chromebooks during this period of school closure.
Request a Chromebook for your student/s here.

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-c5RTEf purZT-AhqUyc-c5RTEf pSzOP-AhqUyc-c5RTEf jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc GNzUNc

div.small: Contact a teacher or other staff member by searching in our staff directory. We will be checking our email and voicemail accounts regularly while school is closed for students.

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-c5RTEf purZT-AhqUyc-c5RTEf pSzOP-AhqUyc-c5RTEf jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc GNzUNc

div.small: Find out what to expect over the next few weeks and resources for talking to your children about COVID-19, as well as how to contact school counselors, mental health staff, and school nurses.

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 wHaque GNzUNc

p.em: The COVID-19 crisis and closing of school has caused many disruptions for our families, particularly related to finding adequate childcare. The Tupper Lake Central School district is currently working with the FEH BOCES to assist families of essential health care workers and first responders to find open childcare placements with local county and current licensed daycare providers. Essential health care workers may include physicians, nurse practitioners, physician assistants, registered nurses, LPNs, nurse assistants, or lab personnel. First responders may include paramedics, EMTs, police officers, and firefighters. If you are an essential health care worker or first responder and need assistance with childcare, please call 518-483-6420 option 9, or send an email to childcare@mail.fehb.org

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc GNzUNc

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Families experiencing homelessness can receive support through the McKinney-Vento Act. Please email Kristin Skiff, TLCSD McKinney-Vento Liason. For more information, visit Mrs. Skiff's website.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc GNzUNc

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: If you are experiencing hardware issues with your school issued Chromebook please email cbhelp@tupperlakecsd.net for assistance.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.small: is for Educational Resources: Tools, sites, tutorials, and more to help our K-6 students at L.P. Quinn to continue their learning from home during our COVID-19 school closure.

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.small: MHS Educational Resources: Links, sites, tutorials, and ideas to help our Middle-High School students to continue their learning from home during our COVID-19 school closure.

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.small: To be eligible to register for Pre-K, a child must be four (4) years of age on or before December 1st, 2020.
To be eligible to register for Kindergarten, a child must be five (5) years of age on or before December 1st, 2020.
